document_title: Decompensated cirrhosis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
The most effective prevention measure for chronic liver diseases, including decompensated cirrhosis, is to eliminate or neutralize the cause of persistent liver damage. Successful suppression of the root cause can prevent or at least slow down the serious progression of the disease.(3)
This is especially true in compensated cirrhosis. Specifically, eliminating the pathogen often effectively prevents decompensation while reducing the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma and prolonging survival. Some useful solutions that patients should note are as follows:
Completely abstain from alcohol; Manage weight appropriately, avoid overweight and obesity; Use medicine, choose medicine carefully to avoid causing liver toxicity; Avoid taking non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).; Vaccination to avoid acute viral injury; Control diabetes.; Have safe sex.; Build a healthy diet with foods rich in fiber (vegetables, fruits), beneficial fats from vegetable oils, fish, nuts...; Maintain a regular exercise routine.; Check the liver regularly to detect abnormal damage early, and then apply timely treatment.
Department of Gastroenterology (Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City) and Department of Gastroenterology - Hepatobiliary - Pancreatic (Tam Anh General Hospital, Hanoi) are prestigious medical centers specializing in Gastroenterology, providing high-quality examination and treatment services. Acute and effective for patients with mild to severe liver problems (fatty liver, acute and chronic hepatitis, cirrhosis, liver cancer...). Tam Anh General Hospital system brings together a team of highly specialized and experienced Internal Medicine - Surgery - Gastrointestinal Endoscopy doctors, in addition to the support of a modern medical equipment system imported from abroad. in addition, serving the maximum examination and treatment needs of customers.
